Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery kantharos; interior glazed black with added red band; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of Zeus to right, the name preserved; part of mouth, beard, neck, chiton and himation covering shoulder and arm preserved; face, neck and some folds in added red; added white rosettes on mantle and white dots on neck band of chiton.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallel kantharoi, see Beazley and Payne 1929, 258, no. 14.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 401, no. B594)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 226, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0739) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 96, pl. III, no. 11)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
